articles.content: Blizzard is running a series of showcases for several of its major franchises and on Wednesday, it was time for Overwatch to step up to the plate. Thatâ€™s Overwatch, by the way, and not Overwatch 2 . The studio is formally nixing the number from the game's name. "Overwatch is more than just a digit: it's a living universe that keeps growing, keeps surprising, and keeps bringing players together from around the world," the Overwatch team said in a statement. "This year marks a huge turning
articles.author: Kris Holt

articles.title: You can pre-order the Pixel 10a on February 18
articles.description: The Pixel 10a is official, though details are limited. On Wednesday, Google posted a teaser video showing the mid-range phone dancing around colorful backgrounds. You can pre-order the Pixel 10a on February 18. Google hasn't yet revealed the phone's specs. In the short video, we can see a blue model
articles.content: The Pixel 10a is official, though details are limited. On Wednesday, Google posted a teaser video showing the mid-range phone dancing around colorful backgrounds. You can pre-order the Pixel 10a on February 18. Google hasn't yet revealed the phone's specs. In the short video, we can see a blue model that's virtually indistinguishable on the outside from the Pixel 9a. And alleged leaks point to a phone with few changes on the inside. That (unconfirmed) list includes a 6.285-inch display, dual rea
articles.author: Will Shanklin

Nobody wants to estimate it because everyone knows it's going to blow up. The last time you tried to tackle something this
articles.content: It's sprint planning day. Someone pulls up a ticket called "Implement user authentication" and the room goes quiet. The story has been sitting in the backlog for three sprints. Nobody wants to estimate it because everyone knows it's going to blow up. The last time you tried to tackle something this size, it turned into a two-week death march that ended with the story getting split mid-sprint anyway. Large user stories are planning poison. They hide complexity, resist estimation, and turn your sp
articles.author: Matt Lewandowski

articles.title: Pick your agent: Use Claude and Codex onÂ AgentÂ HQ
articles.description: Claude by Anthropic and OpenAI Codex are now available in public preview on GitHub and VS Code with a Copilot Pro+ or Copilot Enterprise subscription. Here's what you need to know and how to get started today. The post Pick your agent: Use Claude and Codex on Agent HQ appeared first on The GitHub Bl
articles.content: Context switching equals friction in software development. Today, we’re removing some of that friction with the latest updates to Agent HQ which lets you run coding agents from multiple providers directly inside GitHub and your editor, keeping context, history, and review attached to your work. Copilot Pro+ and Copilot Enterprise users can now run multiple coding agents directly inside GitHub, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio Code (with Copilot CLI support coming soon). That means you can
articles.author: Mario Rodriguez

"We know the algorithm is dumb and needs massive improvements, but at least you can see us struggle to make it better in real-time a
articles.content: When X's engineering team published the code that powers the platform's "for you" algorithm last month, Elon Musk said the move was a victory for transparency. "We know the algorithm is dumb and needs massive improvements, but at least you can see us struggle to make it better in real-time and with transparency," Musk wrote . "No other social media companies do this." While it's true that X is the only major social network to make elements of its recommendation algorithm open source,
articles.author: Karissa Bell

articles.title: OpenClaw’s AI ‘skill’ extensions are a security nightmare
articles.description: OpenClaw, the AI agent that has exploded in popularity over the past week, is raising new security concerns after researchers uncovered malware in hundreds of user-submitted "skill" add-ons on its marketplace. In a post on Monday, 1Password product VP Jason Meller says OpenClaw's skill hub has becom
articles.content: OpenClaw, the AI agent that has exploded in popularity over the past week, is raising new security concerns after researchers uncovered malware in hundreds of user-submitted "skill" add-ons on its marketplace. In a post on Monday , 1Password product VP Jason Meller says OpenClaw's skill hub has become "an attack surface," with the most-downloaded add-on serving as a "malware delivery vehicle." OpenClaw - first called Clawdbot, then Moltbot - is billed as an AI agent that "actually does things,"
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.content: Keanu Reeves in Outcome. | Image: Apple For much of its existence, Apple's streaming service has seemed intent to focus on quality over quantity, offering some great shows but often feeling barren in comparison to competitors like Netflix and Disney. But as Apple TV looks to expand its reach to hit a larger audience , it appears the "quantity" part of that equation is being addressed to some degree. Fresh off detailing returning series Ted Lasso and Sugar , Apple just announced a deluge of title

articles.title: What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built
articles.description: What languages are growing fastest, and why? What about the projects that people are interested in the most? Where are new developers cutting their teeth? Letâ€™s take a look at Octoverse data to find out. The post What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built appeared first
articles.content: In 2025, software development crossed a quiet threshold. In our latest Octoverse report , we found that the fastest-growing languages, tools, and open source projects on GitHub are no longer about shipping more code. Instead, they’re about reducing friction in a world where AI is helping developers build more, faster. By looking at some of the areas of fastest growth over the past year, we can see how developers are adapting through: The programming languages that are growing most in AI-as
articles.author: Dylan Birtolo

In the months since, thousands of immigrants have been swept up by Immigrations and Customs Enforcement. In January alone, two Ame
articles.content: In late 2025, the Department of Homeland Security zeroed in on the Twin Cities in Minnesota, supposedly in response to fraud allegations made by a right-wing influencer. In the months since, thousands of immigrants have been swept up by Immigrations and Customs Enforcement. In January alone, two American citizens were killed while documenting ICE operations in the city. Two Customs and Border Protection agents deployed to Minneapolis fatally shot protester Alex Pretti on January 24th, triggering

One potential source of electricity for these facilities is next-generation nuclear power plants , which could be cheaper to construct and safer to operate than thei

articles.title: When "Internal" Stops Meaning Safe
articles.description: For a long time, internal was a boundary. If traffic stayed inside the network perimeter, if services talked over RFC 1918 address space, if access required VPN tunnels or corporate SAML assertionsâ€”we treated it as lower risk. Not risk-free. Just understood. The kind of understood where you'd grant
articles.content: For a long time, internal was a boundary. If traffic stayed inside the network perimeter, if services talked over RFC 1918 address space, if access required VPN tunnels or corporate SAML assertionsâ€”we treated it as lower risk. Not risk-free. Just understood. The kind of understood where you'd grant broader permissions, skip TLS mutual authentication, maybe log less aggressively because the threat model felt bounded. That mental model no longer holds. Modern systems rarely fail because someone ac
articles.author: Iyanu David

articles.description: Despite the about-face, some customers think "the damage is done."
articles.content: Adobe has canceled plans to discontinue its 2D animation software Animate. On Monday, Adobe announced that it would stop allowing people to sell subscriptions to Animate on March 1, saying the software had â€œserved its purpose." People who already had a software license would be able to keep using Animate with technical support until March 1, 2027; businesses had until March 1, 2029. articles.title: NASA finally acknowledges the elephant in the room with the SLS rocket
articles.description: "You know, you're right, the flight rateâ€”three years is a long time."
articles.content: The Space Launch System rocket program is now a decade and a half old, and it continues to be dominated by two unfortunate traits: It is expensive, and it is slow. The massive rocket and its convoluted ground systems, so necessary to baby and cajole the booster's prickly hydrogen propellant on board, have cost US taxpayers in excess of $30 billion to date. And even as it reaches maturity, the rocket is going nowhere fast. You remember the last time NASA tried to launch the world's largest orange

articles.content: The groundhog has predicted six more weeks of winter, which means more time indoors on our devices â€” and that means it's a great time to improve your cybersecurity . By subscribing to a virtual private network (VPN) and connecting every time you get online, you can keep your activity hidden from your ISP and any advertisers it may sell that data to â€” all while streaming sporting events and TV dramas from all across the globe. We strongly recommend using a VPN , but shopping for one takes some ca

articles.title: Russian spy satellites have intercepted EU communications satellites
articles.description: Unencrypted European communications are being targeted by Moscow.
articles.content: European security officials believe two Russian space vehicles have intercepted the communications of at least a dozen key satellites over the continent. Officials believe that the likely interceptions, which have not previously been reported, risk not only compromising sensitive information transmitted by the satellites but could also allow Moscow to manipulate their trajectories or even crash them. Russian space vehicles have shadowed European satellites more intensively over the past three ye
